ITB Siapkan SOP dan Lembaga Khusus Tangani Bencana
01 Nov 2019, 15:27 by Catur Ratna Wulandari
BANDUNG, (PR).- Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB) bersama dengan Badan Nasional Penanggulangan Bencana (BNPB) tengah mempersiapkan prosedur standar operasional dalam rangka mewujudkan ITB sebagai perguruan tinggi tangguh bencana.Â 
"Mudah-mudahan tahun depan sudah jadi," kata Rektor ITB Kadarsyah Suryadi usai peluncuran dan Focus Group Discussion Menuju ITB Perguruan TInggi Tangguh Bencana di Rektorat ITB, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Ia mengatakan, dalam penyusunan ini ITB berpatokan pada masukan dan rambu-rambu yang diberikan oleh BNPB. ITB akan melibatkan seluruh disiplin ilmu dan kelompok keahlian yang ada di ITB. "Kami lakukan lintas disiplin karena ini tidak bisa satu disiplin ilmu saja. Dengan disiplin ilmu yang ada, ada 110 kelompk keahlian, sebagian besar kami libatkan semua terutama yang relevan," tuturnya.
Selain menyiapkan prosedur standar operasional menghadapi bencana, ITB juga menyiapkan lembaga khusus yang menangani ketangguhan bencana di tiga kampus ITB. Lembaga yang disebut dengan Pusat Komando Kedaruratan atau Emergency Crisisi Center (ECC) itu menjadi tempat kegiatan manajemen darurat berlangsung. ECC berperan mengelola sumber daya dan komunikasi untuk menanggapi kejadian di kampus.
Menurut konsep yang dirancang ITB, ECC akan diaktifkan setelah Rektor ITB atau yang ditunjuknya memproklamirkan keadaan darurat kampus. ECC akan diaktifkan secara otomatis ke tingkat staf yang sesuai dengan ruang llingkup keadaan darurat.
Kadarsyah mengatakan, meski disusun dan dirancang ITB, konsep perguruan tinggi tangguh bencana ini akan menjadi model yang bisa dimanfaatkan oleh lembaga pendidikan lainnya.
"Kalau sudah disusun akan diduplikasi untuk sekolah lain dan kampus lain. Kami pun masih belajar, tadi dapat masukan luar biasa. Tujuannya nanti semua pihak di negeri ini punya kesiapan, ketangguhan terhadap bencana," katanya.
Kepala BNPB Doni Monardo mengatakan, ITB merupakan kampus pertama di Jawa Barat yang mempelopori pengembangan kampus tangguh bencana. Ia mengatakan, potensi bencana di Bandung cukup besar. ITB berada di dekat jalur sesar aktif seperti Sesar Lembang. ITB juga dekat dengan gunung api aktif yaitu Gunung Tangkubanparahu.
ITB juga telah mengidentifikasi sejumlah potensi bencana di kampus ITB lainnya. Misalnya saja sesar Bareibis-Kendeng yang berada di dekat Kampus ITB Cirebon. Demikian pula dengan ancaman gunung meletus di Gunung Ciremai. Ancaman banjir juga tinggi di kampus ITB Cirebon. Gempa megathrust di Selatan Jawa juga mengancam kampus ITB Cirebon. Berdasarkan probabilitas goncangan 10 persen dalam 50 tahun, potensi goncangan gempa di ketiga kampus ITB (Bandung, Cirebon, dan Jatinangor) setara dengan intensitas VI-VIII yang dapat berdampak kerusakan meluas.
Doni mengatakan, BNPB sendiri tidak menerapkan prosedur standar operasional yang sama untuk semua kampus. Hal Standar itu disesuaikan dengan ancaman bencana yang dihadapi masing-masing kampus.
BNPB berharap kerja sama dengan ITB dalam b idang penanggulangan bencana bisa ditingkatkan. Selain mempersiapkan kampu stangguh bencana, kerja sama itu bisa berupa riset kebencanaan.
"Ketika nanti ada kejadian bencana, maka tim dari ITB bersama tim reaksi cepat dari BNPB untuk berada di lapangan melakukan kajian dan penelitian sehingga mendapat gambaran yang lebih utuh," katanya.***

ITB Prepares SOPs and Special Institutions Handling Disasters
01 Nov 2019, 15:27 by Catur Ratna Wulandari
BANDUNG, (PR) .- Bandung Institute of Technology (ITB) together with the National Disaster Management Agency (BNPB) are preparing operational standard procedures in order to realize ITB as a disaster resilient tertiary institution.
"Hopefully next year it will be ready," said ITB Rector Kadarsyah Suryadi after the launch and Focus Group Discussion Towards ITB High School Resilient Disaster at the ITB Rectorate, Friday, November 1, 2019.
He said, in this preparation ITB was based on input and guidelines provided by BNPB. ITB will involve all disciplines and expertise groups in ITB. "We do interdisciplinary because this cannot be just one discipline. With the existing disciplines, there are 110 groups of expertise, most of whom we involve are all especially relevant," he said.
In addition to preparing standard operational procedures for dealing with disasters, ITB also prepares special institutions that handle disaster resilience at three ITB campuses. The institution, called the Emergency Command Center or Emergency Crisisi Center (ECC), is the place where emergency management activities take place. The ECC has the role of managing resources and communication to respond to events on campus.
According to the concept designed by ITB, the ECC will be activated after the ITB Chancellor or his appointee proclaims a campus emergency. The ECC will be activated automatically at the appropriate staff level in the emergency room.
Kadarsyah said, even though ITB was designed and designed, the concept of this disaster resilient tertiary institution would be a model that could be utilized by other educational institutions.
"If it has been prepared, it will be duplicated for other schools and other campuses. We are still learning, before we could get extraordinary input. The goal is that all parties in this country will have preparedness, resilience to disasters," he said.
BNPB Head Doni Monardo said, ITB was the first campus in West Java that pioneered the development of a disaster resilient campus. He said, the potential for disaster in Bandung was quite large. ITB is near active fault lines such as the Lembang Fault. ITB is also close to the active volcano, Mount Tangkubanparahu.
ITB has also identified a number of potential disasters on other ITB campuses. For example, the Bareibis-Kendeng fault which is near the ITB Cirebon Campus. Likewise, the threat of a volcano erupting on Mount Ciremai. The threat of flooding is also high on the ITB Cirebon campus. The megathrust earthquake in South Java also threatened the ITB Cirebon campus. Based on the 10 percent probability of shaking in 50 years, the potential for earthquake shocks on the three ITB campuses (Bandung, Cirebon and Jatinangor) is equivalent to the intensity of VI-VIII which can have widespread damage impacts.
Doni said, BNPB itself did not apply the same standard operating procedures for all campuses. This standard is adjusted to the threat of disasters faced by each campus.
BNPB hopes that cooperation with ITB in the field of disaster management can be increased. In addition to preparing for disaster resilience, the cooperation can take the form of disaster research.
"When there is a disaster later, the team from ITB together with the quick reaction team from BNPB to be in the field conduct studies and research so that they get a more complete picture," he said. ***
